message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm sure you'll love. I'm willing to let it go for $150. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but $150 is a bit steep for me. I was thinking more along the lines of $120.
I understand you're looking for a good deal, Bob. However, I've invested a lot in this product and I'm not sure I can go as low as $120. I can meet you in the middle at $135. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me in the middle, but $135 is still a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to pay $110 for the product. Can you consider that?

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I'm starting to think I might be leaving money on the table if I sell it to you at $110. I can do $125, but that's as low as I'm willing to go. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to come down to $125, but I'm still a bit short. I'm willing to pay $115 for the product. Can you consider that?

I'm starting to think we're getting close, Bob. I can see you're serious about this product, but I need to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you at $122.50. That's the lowest I can go. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $122.50, but I'm still a bit short. I'm willing to pay $115. Can you consider that?

Bob, I'm starting to think we're going around in circles. I'm willing to make one final offer. I'll meet you at $118. That's as low as I'm willing to go. If you're not interested, I'll have to consider other options. What do you think?
I appreciate your final offer, but I'm still a bit short. I'm willing to pay $110 for the product. This is my last offer.
